ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The lower part of the uterus occupying the region between the isthmus of the uterus and the vagina. It is divided into supravaginal and vaginal portions._A common cancer characterized by the presence of malignant glandular cells. Morphologically, adenocarcinomas are classified according to the growth pattern (e.g., papillary, alveolar) or according to the secreting product (e.g., mucinous, serous). Representative examples of adenocarcinoma are ductal and lobular breast carcinoma, lung adenocarcinoma, renal cell carcinoma, hepatocellular carcinoma (hepatoma), colon adenocarcinoma, and prostate adenocarcinoma._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._Histology is the study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor arising from the epithelial cells. Microscopically, the neoplastic epithelial cells form cylindrical spatial configurations (cribriform or classic type of adenoid cystic carcinoma), cordlike structures (tubular type of adenoid cystic carcinoma), or solid structures (basaloid variant of adenoid cystic carcinoma). Adenoid cystic carcinomas mostly occur in the salivary glands. Other primary sites of involvement include the lacrimal gland, the larynx, and the lungs. Adenoid cystic carcinomas spread along nerve sheaths, resulting in severe pain, and they tend to recur. Lymph node metastases are unusual; hematogenous tumor spread is characteristic.: A malignant tumor arising from the epithelial cells. Microscopically, the neoplastic epithelial cells form cylindrical spatial configurations (cribriform or classic type of adenoid cystic carcinoma), cordlike structures (tubular type of adenoid cystic carcinoma), or solid structures (basaloid variant of adenoid cystic carcinoma). Adenoid cystic carcinomas mostly occur in the salivary glands. Other primary sites of involvement include the lacrimal gland, the larynx, and the lungs. Adenoid cystic carcinomas spread along nerve sheaths, resulting in severe pain, and they tend to recur. Lymph node metastases are unusual; hematogenous tumor spread is characteristic.

Concepts.definition: A malignant tumor arising from the epithelial cells.  Microscopically, the neoplastic epithelial cells form cylindrical spatial configurations (cribriform or classic type of adenoid cystic carcinoma), cordlike structures (tubular type of adenoid cystic carcinoma), or solid structures (basaloid variant of adenoid cystic carcinoma).  Adenoid cystic carcinomas mostly occur in the salivary glands.  Other primary sites of involvement include the lacrimal gland, the larynx, and the lungs.  Adenoid cystic carcinomas spread along nerve sheaths, resulting in severe pain, and they tend to recur.  Lymph node metastases are unusual; hematogenous tumor spread is characteristic.

A malignant tumor arising from the epithelial cells.  Microscopically, the neoplastic epithelial cells form cylindrical spatial configurations (cribriform or classic type of adenoid cystic carcinoma), cordlike structures (tubular type of adenoid cystic carcinoma), or solid structures (basaloid variant of adenoid cystic carcinoma).  Adenoid cystic carcinomas mostly occur in the salivary glands.  Other primary sites of involvement include the lacrimal gland, the larynx, and the lungs.  Adenoid cystic carcinomas spread along nerve sheaths, resulting in severe pain, and they tend to recur.  Lymph node metastases are unusual; hematogenous tumor spread is characteristic.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A rare low grade carcinoma that arises from the cervix. It is characterized by the presence of nests of basaloid cells with focal glandular formations.

Concepts.definition: A rare low grade carcinoma that arises from the cervix. It is characterized by the presence of nests of basaloid cells with focal glandular formations.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A malignant epithelial neoplasm composed of atypical cells with glassy cytoplasm.

Concepts.definition: A malignant epithelial neoplasm composed of atypical cells with glassy cytoplasm.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A mixed adenocarcinoma and squamous cell or epidermoid carcinoma.

Concepts.definition: An invasive carcinoma composed of malignant glandular cells and malignant squamous cells.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The lower part of the uterus occupying the region between the isthmus of the uterus and the vagina. It is divided into supravaginal and vaginal portions.:Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:A diagnostic test used to examine and define microscopic tissue structure, composition, or etiology.
